thread.title: WorkWave Acquires Cube Six, Inc., the Provider of ServMan Software, to Extend Its Market Position in Field Service to the HVAC, Electrical and Plumbing Industries

author: cnbc.com
title: WorkWave Acquires Cube Six, Inc., the Provider of ServMan Software, to Extend Its Market Position in Field Service to the HVAC, Electrical and Plumbing Industries
text:
HOLMDEL, N.J., March 21, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- WorkWave® ( www.WorkWave.com ), a leading provider of cloud-based software solutions for the field service, "last mile" delivery and logistics industries is excited to announce that it has acquired Cube Six, Inc. – a leading provider of fully-integrated field service ERP solutions for the HVAC, Electrical and Plumbing markets, including its flagship product, ServMan.
Based in Indian Trail, North Carolina, Cube Six has been in business since 2001, and serves clients such as Morris Jenkins, Tudi Mechanical, and Air Group. Its ServMan product is named a "Master" in Software Advice's FrontRunners® for Field Service quadrant by Gartner, and averages 4.5 Stars on Capterra .
The addition of ServMan to the WorkWave solution portfolio expands WorkWave's market-leadership in the field service space to HVAC, Electrical and Plumbing, combining deep industry expertise with extensive software capabilities, helping customers to optimize all aspects of operations – from increasing back office efficiencies such as scheduling, billing and inventory management, to improving mobile field worker productivity via routing and tracking, and enhancing front office capabilities that improve the customer experience and drive new business.
"We are very excited to welcome Rob Webster and his team to the WorkWave family," said Chris Sullens, CEO of WorkWave. "They have the broad software capabilities, the industry knowledge, and commitment to customer service that is necessary to help us serve the needs of small to mid-market companies operating in the HVAC, Electrical, and Plumbing markets. This combination will enhance our already robust software capabilities and industry expertise, while accelerating our growth moving forward."
Rob Webster, CEO of Cube Six, stated: "We are very excited to join the WorkWave team and looking forward to mutually accelerating our growth in the field service space. Being a part of WorkWave will greatly benefit our clients, partners, and employees going forward."
About WorkWave
WorkWave, an IFS company, is dedicated to simplifying the complexity of running field service and other fleet-based businesses, large or small - a $45+ billion market worldwide. The company's suite of solutions, which include PestPac®, WorkWave Service™, ServiceCEO™, WorkWave Route Manager™, WorkWave GPS™, GPS Heroes™ and ContactUs™, allow WorkWave clients to easily attribute and automate sales and marketing activities, improve their back-office efficiency and increase their visibility into field operations through a single, easy to use interface. WorkWave's platform provides its 8,000+ clients an unprecedented level of business insight and information, enabling them to increase efficiency, increase revenue and provide a 5-Star customer experience. WorkWave has been recognized with multiple awards for its outstanding growth and culture, including the Inc. 5000, SaaS Award, and Best Place to Work by NJBiz & Inc. Magazine. For more information, visit www.workwave.com .
About Cube Six and ServMan Software
Based in Indian Trail, North Carolina, Cube Six has been business since 2001, and is the provider of ServMan, a leading Field Service software solution. ServMan is a leading Field Service ERP solution designed for the residential and commercial HVAC, Plumbing and Electrical markets. ServMan's fully integrated field service management application includes a full accounting module, sophisticated scheduling and routing solutions, a robust mobile solution for paperless work order management, quoting and sales presentations, and also offers client-facing web portals that further automate business processes as client service orders and payments.
